channel.title: How to set up Java (windows 7)
channel.description:
well i got a laptop for x-mas and i have been trying to fix the java set up to work for my laptop, now, JDK was a useful for XP and vista, with window 7 java files are differently setup.
now there are JDK codes for windows 7 that take longer to add and require all of setting to be changed.
Right now Jre6 with JDK (atm update 17) is the best java for windows 7 (for server running)
go to: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
Download JDK with Jre! (all other java without Jre are 50% likely to glitch up on windows 7, trust me i went though it) [IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/106k40j.png[/img]
Once installed time to edit the Enviroment Variables:
go to start and right click computer, then hit properties [IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/2lt4im8.png[/img]
Click Advance settings [IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/2cyhdvc.png[/img]
Enviroment Variables.. [IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/z3577.png[/img]
Now click new and put these codes and names in:
Variable Name: CLASSPATH
Variable code: [code]CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code]
Variable name: PATH
Variable code: [code]C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin;[/code]
This code is 100% made my by, i used no tuts to make it cause its easy to make these, its just hard to find the working java that works with new operating systems. [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/29yf95x.png[/img]

item.title: How to set up Java (windows 7)
item.dc:creator: @mylust4blood mylust4blood
item.description:
@mylust4blood wrote:

well i got a laptop for x-mas and i have been trying to fix the java set up to work for my laptop, now, JDK was a useful for XP and vista, with window 7 java files are differently setup.

now there are JDK codes for windows 7 that take longer to add and require all of setting to be changed.

Right now Jre6 with JDK (atm update 17) is the best java for windows 7 (for server running)

go to: http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp

Download JDK with Jre! (all other java without Jre are 50% likely to glitch up on windows 7, trust me i went though it)

Once installed time to edit the Enviroment Variables:

go to start and right click computer, then hit properties

Click Advance settings

Enviroment Variablesâ€¦

Now click new and put these codes and names in:

Variable Name: CLASSPATH

Variable code: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Variable name: PATH

Variable code: C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin;

This code is 100% made my by, i used no tuts to make it cause its easy to make these, its just hard to find the working java that works with new operating systems.
